question: Every vertex in a connected graph must have a self-loop.
A tree with n vertices always has exactly n-1 edges.
Every bipartite graph is also a complete graph.
The complement of a connected graph is always disconnected.
Every directed graph contains at least one directed cycle.
A permutation is an ordered arrangement of distinct elements.
A Hamiltonian path visits every vertex in a graph exactly once.
Every planar graph can be drawn without any edge crossings.
A function that is not injective cannot be surjective.
The power set of a set always has more elements than the original set.
